intro: Lupinus amnis-otuni, commonly known as the Otún lupine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces spikes of showy, violet to blue flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lupinus amnis-otuni is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its ecological importance includes nitrogen fixation, which enriches the soil in its native habitat.
